New Records: The Padres crushed a franchise playoff record six home runs
The six homers also tied an MLB playoff record
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. hit two of those home runs
Jurickson Profar robbed a home run from Mookie Betts
Jack Flaherty and Manny Machado had words
Fans at Dodger Stadium threw items onto the field, including a couple balls at Profar and bottles at Tatis
Manny Machado pulled the team together to have a meeting after everything that took place at Dodger Stadium
Pre-Game Insights: Freddie Freeman's status was up in the air until just before the series got underway on Saturday because of the ankle he rolled late in the regular season
Freeman appeared to put any lingering concerns about his availability to rest in Game 1
Freeman departed Game 2 during the middle innings with ankle discomfort
Post-Match Reflections: Freeman's status for Game 3 is unclear
Xander Bogaerts appeared to tweak his hamstring during his eighth-inning at-bat, hit a home run, then left the game
Freeman exited the game in the fifth inning with soreness in his sprained right ankle
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was delayed during the bottom of the seventh inning by more than 10 minutes after Dodgers fans threw items onto the field
The Padres will have relocated to Petco Park in San Diego for Game 3
The Padres are set to start right-hander Michael King, who was stellar in the wild-card round against the Braves
The Dodgers will counter with righty Walker Buehler
